title: 103_s679
content: Section 302(b) is amended to allow the Committee on Ways and Means or the Committee on Finance to initiate an investigation on foreign acts, policies, or practices that may violate section 301. The United States Trade Representative is no longer required to take action in certain cases under Section 301. The amendment also specifies the instances where action is not mandatory. The United States Trade Representative is no longer obligated to act in certain cases under Section 301, with specified exceptions. The Trade Representative is required to implement actions directed by the President under Section 301 within 30 days, with exceptions specified in the amendment to Section 305. The amendment specifies the timeline for the Trade Representative to implement actions directed by the President under Section 301, with exceptions outlined in the amendment to Section 305. Additionally, changes are made to sections 301 and 306 regarding foreign compliance monitoring. The amendment modifies various sections related to trade actions, including changes to sections 301, 307, and 152 of the Trade Act of 1974. The Trade Act of 1974 is amended to include special rules relating to congressional procedures under section 301(a)(1)(B)(ii).
